results.title: The German language series. Part 3
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: This series allows the student to hear and see native speakers of German conducting a conversation lasting about two minutes. The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part three presents dialogue on a picnic students are planning, using sentences of different structural types. In English and German.

results.title: The German language series. Part 1
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: This series allows the student to hear and see native speakers of German conducting a conversation lasting about two minutes. The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part one presents dialogue on the arrival in Germany of a friend from America, using simple sentences with present tense. In English and German.

results.title: The Geography of Canada
results.brief_description: Documentary short on Canada’s geographical regions - the Pacific West Coast, the Interior Plains, the Canadian Shield, the St. Lawrence Valley, Appalachian region; and the arctic. Both animated dolls and live footage are used to provide facts on plant and animal life, Canada’s neighbours, climatic conditions, natural resources and wildlife conservation. Scenes of a beaver building a dam.

results.title: The Gentleman in room 6
results.creator_credit: George K. Arthur, Meteor Films and Alexander Hammid
results.brief_description: Short story film about a derelict and forgotten character hiding in a room womewhere in South America. he is confronted by three of his old associates, each of whom provides further clues to his identity which is revealed in the last few seconds of the film.

results.title: The Genetic chance
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Children My Children”.
Examines the moral and social implications of determining genetic disorders in unborn infants, and looks at the effects of a number of such disorders. Most of the discussion is centred around haemophilia.

results.title: The Genesis of a dissident
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet Government and Politics”.
One of a series of films which make up a third level course from the Faculty of Social Science Open University. Offers an introduction to contemporary Soviet politics whilst simultaneously relating political practice to the historical development of the Soviet State and Marxist political theory. Presented by Victor Fainberg.

results.title: The General. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Film Classics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version of Clyde Bruckman and Buster Keaton’s 1926 comedy feature, showing Buster Keaton in his most successful period as an actor and director of this satire on Civil War espionage. Combines good examples of Keaton’s dry wit and acute sense of timing. This edited work, narrated by Paul Killiam, indicates the significance of ‘The General’ in film history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Film Classics

results.title: The General Assembly
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films, V.R. Sarma and Krishna Singh
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the United Nations General Assembly and describes its efforts to promote human welfare and peace among the peoples of the world. Surveys the organisation of the General Assembly, areas of jurisdiction, and the work of committees. Includes scenes of an annual session as delegates and visitors arrive. Narrated by Michael Rennie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Nations Films, V.R. Sarma and Krishna Singh
